questions.question_text:
An administrator does not want to report the logon events of service accounts to FortiGate.
What setting on the collector agent is required to achieve this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct:
A. Add user accounts to the Ignore User List. 

FortiGate Infrastructure 7.2 Study Guide (p.144):
"The FSSO collector agent ignores any login events that match the Ignore User List entries. Therefore, these login events are not recorded by the collector agent, nor are they reported to FortiGate."

Reference and download study guide:
https://ebin.pub/fortinet-fortigate-infrastructure-study-guide-for-fortios-72.html
ANSWER IS A

Selected Answer: A
Study Guide – FSSO – FSSO Settings – Ignore User List.

The FSSO collector agent ignores any logon events that match the Ignore User List entries. Therefore, these logo events are not recorded by the collector agent, nor are they reported to FG.

It is a good practice to add all network service accounts to the Ignore User List. Service accounts tend to overwrite user logon events, and create issues with identity-based policy matching.
